fields.description:
If you call the method above for PluginController.class, you'll get 3 entries back, all mapped to the same instance.  One for:
* PluginController
* PluginAccessor
* PluginManager

This is currently breaking some SAL func tests, but aside from that I also think it's a little confusing.  I think that call should only return one mapping.  It's used in the DefaultHostContextAccessor.
fields.summary: ComponentManager.getComponentsOfTypeMap(iface) returns three entries for PluginController.class

fields.description:
This search request returns quite quickly:

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&pid=10470&sorter/field=created&sorter/order=DESC&tempMax=20

The same query as an RSS feed never returns:

http://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-rss/temp/SearchRequest.xml?pid=10470&sorter/field=created&sorter/order=DESC&tempMax=20

Could be related to the performance problems from Friday?
fields.summary: RSS requests take way longer than corresponding search request on JAC

fields.description:
In JRA-9220 the 'luckySearch' option was added and it was triggered by a ctrl-enter from the quick search field. We have a custom field that has a unique ID (migrated issue number). I'd like to be able to generate a URL that linked directly to the JIRA case that has this custom field=<some search term>. I've got a URL all set that sends me to the search results with a single case as the search results. I'd like to be able to add '&luckySearch=true' to the URL so that it would navigate to the first (and only) search results saving the user an extra click.

I know it's a minor issue, but the code exists, it just needs to be added back in (sans the javascript ctrl-enter trigger that was causing IE problems).
fields.summary: Add back in the ability to preform a 'I'm feeling luck search" by using a static url

fields.description:
The "Date Picker" appears on the Issue Filter even though it is supposed to be set to hidden. 

*Steps to reproduce:*

1) Create two new custom fields:
||Field Name||FIeld Type||Context||Image Associated||
|Test Text Field|Text Field|Global| Create test field.jpeg|
|Test Date Field|Date Picker|Global|Create date field.jpeg| 
Overview: Two custom fields.jpeg

2) Edit an active Field Configuration so that these new custom fields are both hidden. (field configuration screen.jpeg)
3) Go to Issue Navigator, select a project that uses the modified Field Configuration. Click the "click here" link to update the search criteria.(Filter and click here.jpeg)
5) See that field 'Test Text Field' is now removed from the available search criteria, but 'Test Date Field' is not.
fields.summary: Date Picker fields won't "hide" on Issue Navigator page

fields.description:
All fields can be hidden on various screens except for the Date picker field. (See Attached screenshots for the steps in images.)

*Steps to Reproduce*

1) Create two new custom fields(names can be whatever you would like):
||Field Name||Field Type||Context||Image Associated||
|Test Text Field|Text field|Global Context|Create Text Field|
|Test Date Field|Date Picker|Global Context| Create Date Field|
2) Edit an active Field Configuration so that these new custom fields are both hidden. (field configuration screen.jpeg and two custom fields.jpeg)
3) Go to Issue Navigator, select a project that uses the modified Field Configuration. Click the "click here" link to update the search criteria. (filter and click here.jpeg)
5) See that field 'text' is now removed from the available search criteria, but 'date picker' is not. (date picker shows up.jpeg)
fields.summary: Date Picker fields won't "hide" on Issue Navigator page

fields.description:
We would like to ability for a project lead to moderate comments entered by users in a customer visible issue/project. We are investigating the possibility of letting our customers into the system and the main concern is that some grad would blab his mouth off about something about which we would really rather the customer was not aware. Having some ability for the project lead to moderate all potentially customer visible comments would go a long way to convincing the powers that be in my company that JIRA is a feasible platform for customer visible issue tracking.

All that aside - keep up the good work! Great product.
fields.summary: Comment moderation by Project Lead for users' customer visible issues

fields.summary: Component plugin modules don't show up in plugins admin section in JIRA 4.0

fields.description:
JIRA's serviceManager allows adding services by name.  This is an example usage from the SAL JiraPluginScheduler service:
{code}
serviceManager.addService(name,
                    "com.atlassian.sal.jira.scheduling.JiraPluginSchedulerService",
                    repeatInterval,
                    serviceDataMap);
{code}

The class that is the actual service is supplied as a string, and the service in JIRA then tries to load this class.  With plugins2 this no longer works if the service class is provided in a plugins2 bundle, since it's in a different classloader.

Here's an example of an error caused by this, when running the SAL CTK test suite, which tests this functionality:

fields.description:
Jira (and may be other Atlassian solutions) need to provide a way to change the system status.

Let''s look into our context. Our Jira implementation has 1190 active users. We currently have 56,000 issues (we have 49'000 in Nov 2008) and we have the intention to migrate to 3.13. First problem, the upgrade proposed by Atlassian is quite combersome, especially that you need to run a backup to have all your issues. 

While planning this I thought what could I do to avoid my users to keep using the system: I can't backup the issues and let them be modified again before completing the migration. So with this in mind I would like to propose the adoption of a system option called "System Operation Mode".

The SOM can have 3 possible values:
1) Production:
2) System Maintenance
3) System Check

In Produciton status, everyone can login and work.

In System Maintenance, only the system administrator can login, all other logins are refused.

In System Check, only the system administrator and a limited number of people (testers) can login. Testers are all the people that are included in a new permission group or role named "System Check users".

In this way, if any operation requires the server UP but all your users off it, you turn the SOM into System Maintenance. The before releasing to public, the admin sets the SOM to System Check and runs the tests with the team and later on the SOM is turned into Production mode.
fields.summary: Jira must provide a maintenance mode setting at server level

fields.description:
Jira updates the index for issues whenever you edit them, right? Could not a full reindex be issued this way also - search all issues and reindex all of them separately, one-by one? This would not require Jira to be locked and would still allow a full reindex to be done, even for very large instances.

Is this possible/easy to implement perhaps? I know it would take a very long time to complete a full reindex this way (depending on the number of issues), but this would also enable making a full reindexing in instances where this is otherwise not possible (24/7 use).
fields.summary: Full reindex without locking Jira - reindex all issues one-by-one?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16346].
  {panel}

When i going to do an Upgrade to a jira
My first action is to go over the Plug ins Jira is using , and making sure i have the latest version of them
And to make sure i will not miss one 
So now i am going on each plug in in the Current Plug ins view
checking if its an in house or not (a plug in came with with the installation)
If you can mark these plug ins , or even better , mark the newly added plugins
it can make my life easier
thanks
Tal
fields.summary: Mark Jira default plugins in the Current Plugins view

fields.description:
It is required that whenever a project is edited for project role, a notification mail should be fired out, so that the user/ developer whose role is going to add/ delete/ modify can notify about the change and accordingly he can act further.
Notification mail should be sent to project members when:
1. Project is initiated
2. Project role is edited
fields.summary: Notification mail while editing a project role

fields.description:
We need to check:

* If we are allowed to set the updatedDate in the transition issue jelly tag then we should allow users to set the resolution date as well, ONLY if they are transitioning to something where we are setting a resolution
* We need to check the CSV importer to make sure we can set the resolutionDate if we are importing an issue and it is in the resolution state
* We need to check the Bugzilla, Mantis, and Fogbugz importers as well.
fields.summary: Need to fix all the means to import data into JIRA to respect the resolution date

fields.description:
The HTML mail template includes the priority, even if it is the default priority.

The plaintext mail template does not include the priority if it is the default priority.

The two templates should be similar so that if a user switches their preference from one to the other the notification contains the same information.
fields.summary: inconsistent priority display in html and text email templates

fields.description:
In our JIRA environment, we have several projects where each of the project admins uploads tasks from a CSV file into their respective project.    Inorder for these project admins have the upload permissions, they need to be part of  the JIRA System Administration group.    This is unacceptable and is a huge security risk.   Right now, the only workaround is for the JIRA  System Admins are forced to perform the Export/Import for all projects.

I'd like to request that an interface be provided where the JIRA System Administrator can set  the privileges for a given group.   For instance if I create a Project Admin group, I, the Jira System Admin, should be able to grant Import and Export rights to that group.   At the moment you have to add them to the Jira System Admin group, just so they can import tasks into JIRA.
fields.summary: Ability to grant Import/Export privileges to a group or a user

fields.description: Right now, it really doesn't make sense that having someone be able to resolve an issue also grants them the permission to set which version it's for, especially if, like us, you're using an agile system where the versions are essentially Milestones. We'd have management determine the milestones, while the developer can resolve issues.
fields.summary: Resolve permission should be separate from fix version

fields.description:
The "Perm Gen" memory usage shown on the System Info page is actually "non-heap memory usage".
This can lead to problems, eg you want 128M Perm Gen, and when you look at System Info page is says that there is 128MB Perm Gen, But really there is only 78MB of PermGen and 50 MB of "other" non-heap memory.
fields.summary: The "Perm Gen" memory usage shown on the System Info page is incorrect.

fields.description:
The standalone JIRA release has 128M max permgen set in setenv.sh / setenv.bat.
However the Windows Installer changes this to 78MB.
fields.summary: The Windows installer PermGen memory settings are lower than for other standalone releases.

fields.description:

# Create a category

## Edit the portlet and select the newly created category

fields.summary: Removing a project category does not reflect at the Project Portlet

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16335].
  {panel}

Due to browser security it is not possible to prefill the file upload input boxes. So if the attachment field appears on e.g. Create Issue screen, and an error is detected with user input, the user is returned on to the Creat Issue form and is asked to correct their input.

The trouble is that the file attachments are lost, as we are not able to prefll the file inout boxes. Even if we were able to do that, the files would be uploaded the second time, which is a waste of time and bandwidth,

The solution is to keep the files on the server side and attach them once the input is validated.

The UI should let the user know that the files have been uploaded and also should allow the user to upload extra files and cancel attaching existing (already uploaded) files.
fields.summary: Keep uploaded files even if the issue operation has been submitted so they do not have to be uploaded again

fields.description:
I was just editing my current workflow for the ... time, because someone wanted to have a new condition in the workflow.
I have seen that there are many posts depending the possibility to translate the steps and transitions of workflows.

The solution can be a whole new redesign of the workflow administration to reach a comfortable way to translate and edit it, without getting lost in unimportant settings. Programs dealing with BPMS use swim-lanes to show the steps depending on roles. The designed process has a defined start and end.

The workflow can be designed with visual support in a graphical-language, that is well known. The global conditions - who may do anything - can be set automatically. Events are generated by the workflow and automatically set in the "post-functions". System-Environments can be added into the workflow as "passive elements" to ensure a safe release. The configuration of released or unreleased versions can be controlled via the workflow. Transition screens are placed by drag and drop.

A transition pool (templates) is used to link the steps. This would avoid the difficult way of editing an XML document to reach the same transition ID. Conditions and post-functions are set by the linked steps.
The translation keys of transitions are set automatically and the words can be added in a new category.
fields.summary: BPMS driven workflow administration

fields.description:
When a user has project administration permission, they are shown a link to edit perforce repository mappings (from the fisheye plugin) even if they don't have permission to do so (not in JIRA Administrators global permission)

Steps to reproduce: 
# Set up perforce integration using the fisheye plugin
# create a project and assign "Administer Project" permission to a user who is *not* in JIRA Administrators global permission
# Login as that user and go to administation -> project
# You will see links to edit {{Repository Path:  None ( Select Path )}} and {{Perforce Configuration: 1666 ( Select )}}. Clicking either of these links will redirect you to the login page without any indication of why. 

If you do not have permission to change the mappings, then the links should be inactive and a message shown saying you will need JIRA Administrators global permission to change the settings.
fields.summary: When a user has project administration project permission, they are shown a link to edit perforce repository mappings even if they don't have permission to do so

fields.description:
(This has been initially assigned a Major priority because no workaround exists.)

As noted in the developer forum (link below), there is no way to disable the "Assign Issue" from within the Operations Menu without removing it from all screens in the project.

The problem we are trying to solve is that we have some workflow steps associated with some customized transition screens.  In one case, we have an Assign transition that is associated with a screen that does much more than change the Assignee field.  We have told the developers on the project to not use the "Assign Issue" link that appears under the "Operations" menu but they still inadvertently use it from time to time.

The desired solution is to remove the "Assign Issue" link from the Operations menu.

We tried to modify the Permissions Scheme such that no one has the "Assign Issue" permission and that does remove it from the Operations screen, but that also removes the "Assignee" field from all other screens and transition screens (including the screen associated with our custom workflow step).

With that said, I think it is just to say that we have found a bug (or an improvement however you look at it).  The overrides provided in the Operations menu are useful at times, so removing them is not desired.  However, the Permissions Scheme needs to be extended to specify who has permission to actions that are listed within the Operations menu.

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257298408
fields.summary: Toggle Permissions for Items in Operations Menu
Coloured highlighting of comments and/or username per user group or project role

fields.description:
All validators must pass in order for a transition to complete. Currently an issue will fail as soon as one validator fails, without running subsequent validators. The disadvantage of this is that it staggers the error messages.

For example in my transition I have several validators, in this order:
1. Fields Required (About a dozen fields must be filled out)
2. Date Compare (I want to validate some date fields)
3. Comment Required (Using a custom plugin I ensure a comment is entered)
4. User Picker Validator (Using a custom plugin I ensure a user picker has a minimum number of users selected and that they have been selected from a particular group)

When a user submits a ticket in violation of all four validators they only see the error from 'Fields Required'. When the required field is added and they resubmit they will then see the error from 'Date Compare', and so forth. The overhead of running all validators is low and, while not logically necessary, having the ability to display all error messages simultaneously would enhance usability. I receive complaints from users who dislike having to keep correcting errors only to resubmit and receive a whole new set of errors.
fields.summary: Run all Validators (continue on failure) during workflow transition

fields.description:
We have discovered a bug in the com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.misc.CreateCommentFunction.java. I have attached our fixed and tested class. Notice the changes on Lines 54-57, checking for a null remote user before sending the username into the create comment function.

Steps to recreate:
# Create new workflow with a transition that has no permission restrictions to execute
# Create a blank screen as the screen for that transition (aka only the comment box shows up)
# assign to a workflow scheme and a project
# allow Group Anyone to add a comment permission on project
# Create an incident
# Log out and execute workflow transition for incident, filling in comment box

Expected result, comment saves as anonymous
Actual result, workflow transition throws NullPointerException.

{noformat}

java.lang.NullPointerException

fields.description:
The [backing up data|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/backup_data.html] docs spell out that attachments aren't stored in the database and must be taken care of separately, including moving directories of files.  

The [upgrading JIRA|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/upgrading.html] docs don't have this spelled out.  

Recently, Christina got a complaint from a customer and this caused major problems and took up time for tech support.  

Can we please spell out the attachment-moving process in the [upgrading JIRA|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/upgrading.html] as well as we do in the [backing up data|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/backup_data.html]?

Another alternative is to link to the xml back up documentation from the upgrade instructions.
fields.summary: Attachment details in the Upgrading JIRA doc

fields.description:
Hi,
We are using an iterative incremental software development using JIRA and the Greenhopper plug-in. 
We need to put the start and end date of an iteration.
JIRA provides filed to enter the end date of the release but not the start date.
Now this creates a problem while using the chart board of GreenHopper which picks up the dates from the JIRA DB. The start date field in GreenHopper's chart board is empty and everytime a new iteration is created there is a chance thet the admin misses on entering the start date which can mess up with the Burndown chart.
How has this been address?
Please help.
fields.summary: Wanted the start date of an iteration for Scrum Method of development

fields.description:
CSV Import is a great feature but only allows to create issues, not to update existing issues.
Jelly Script is another great feature but there is no available documentation on how to update existing issues.
The Bulk Change allows to update a list of issues but the new values of the updated field has to be the same for all the issues in the list.

We need to be able without messing with the SQL data base to update a list of issues from a CSV file that would provide the new values of the updated fields.
fields.summary: CSV Update: provide a way to update a list of issues through CSV import

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16282].
  {panel}

We're not on JIRA yet (hopefully soon), but couldn't keep myself from entering a new feature request:
It would be great if there would be a Visual Studio (.NET) IDE integration for JIRA.

A suggested feature for such integration:
- Allow the developer to associate the VS project with JIRA 'components' (association would be saved in the VS project file)
- Make the list of issues for those components easily accessible

Then you immediately see which issues/tasks you can fix along with the things you were already planning to do.

fields.description: A possibility to assign all subtasks of a task in one operation would be handy. Or more generally, assignment of more related issues at once. I didn't notice such feature in current version.
fields.summary: Assign all subtasks in one step

fields.description:
It would be very useful to be able to search for issues that affect associated versions, without having to specifically pick every version required.

For example, if we have versions 1.1, 1.2, 1.3, 2.0, 2.1, 2.2, then being able to create a filter that searches for 1.x would be useful - the aim is that when 1.4 is released a new filter is not needed.

For my purpose I am creating a confluence page for version 1 & one for version 2 and these have links to JIRA filters. Each time I create a new version, I have to edit the wiki pages (and in my case there are many versions of product available).
fields.summary: Add ability to search for versions using regex or similar

fields.description:
Sometimes JIRA writes in log:
INFO [jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Optimising the index because 4000 issues have been re-indexed since
 last optimise. Threshold is 4000.
After that it's locks indexes and overall performance. It takes about 1,5 minutes, during which we have average 5-6 updates (sometimes 10-15). All this updates are finished with IndexException. The result is outdated indexes for all failed operations (Issue navigator values don't corresponds to real state of Issues)
fields.summary: Optimizing index during intensive work causes problems

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16258].
  {panel}

Issue's status and resolution together defines "state" for an issue. For example, issue can be OPEN(Unresolved), RESOLVED(Fixed, Obsolete, etc.)  or CLOSED(Fixed, Obsolete, etc.).

There is a difference for an issue being in status RESOLVED with resolution Fixed compared to situation where the issue is in status CLOSED with resolution Fixed. For example, if a bug issue is RESOLVED (Fixed) the bug may be fixed, but when the issue is CLOSED(Fixed) the bug is both fixed AND verified (someone has checked that the fix really fixes the bug). Of course this depends how do you model your bug reporting process within Jira, but I guess you got the point.

Anyway, the problem is that the roadmap report does not tell state of issues that well. Yes, it shows the resolution, but for the status all you can see is the icon. See attached image for reference.

So, a significant improvement would be if you can make Roadmap report customizable (just like it's possible to customize view for sub-tasks in parent issue, see http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-16098). So, basically I would like to configure which fields are shown and in which order in the roadmap report.

Or is this already possible somehow?
fields.summary: Make the Roadmap report customizable

fields.description:
If JIRA is integrated with Crowd, and Crowd has password restrictions (e.g. regex), a user will receive a stack trace in JIRA if the new password does not meet Crowd's password requirements (e.g. through the Forgot Password link in JIRA).    

{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Could not change the password for USER. Reason: Your new password does not meet the directory complexity requirements
	at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.osuser.CrowdCredentialsProvider.changePassword(CrowdCredentialsProvider.java:106)
	at com.opensymphony.user.User.setPassword(User.java:102)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.user.ChangePassword.doExecute(ChangePassword.java:36)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:54)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:132)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraServletDispatcher.service(JiraServletDispatcher.java:178)
{noformat}

This may require a fix in both Crowd and JIRA.  On the Crowd side, the client library may need to let JIRA know about the password restrictions for this JIRA instance.  On the JIRA side, JIRA will need to read any password restrictions provided by Crowd for this app and catch the IllegalArgumentException to provide a more elegant message when password criteria is not met.
fields.summary: Forgot Password/Crowd Integration exception handling and regex improvements

fields.description:
Enterprise Edition, Version: 3.13.2-#335
It is often useful to know the ticket number of a resolved (has strikethrough) ticket, without actually clicking the link. Especially, '0' and '9' are impossible to distinguish. The mouse over text does not list the ticket number. The only solution seems to be to add the ticket number to the mouse over text.
fields.summary: Can't read JIRA ticket number after strikethrough (resolved) is applied; '0' and '9' look the same. Adding ticket number to mouse over text would help.

fields.description:
Hello all,

as part of my induction I built JIRA from source and encountered some difficulties that could be avoided with minor documentation correction:

1. Page http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13.2/building.html should link to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEVNET/Atlassian+Maven+Repositories when describing how to configure the maven2 repos.

2. The page itself should point out how to install non re-distributable dependencies and get the environment ready before attempting a build. I've found "mail", "activation" and "transaction" APIs sufficient. The following commands should save users from 3 failed attempts:

   mvn install:install-file -DgroupId=javax.mail -DartifactId=mail -Dversion=1.3.2 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=$HOME/Downloads/mail-1.3.2.jar 
   mvn install:install-file -DgroupId=javax.activation -DartifactId=activation -Dversion=1.0.2 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=$HOME/Downloads/activation-1.0.2.jar
   mvn install:install-file -DgroupId=javax.transaction -DartifactId=jta -Dversion=1.0.1B -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=$HOME/Downloads/jta-1_0_1B-classes.zip

cheers,
e
fields.summary: Source Build documentation is out of date and incomplete

fields.description:
The [Editing an active workflow documentation|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/workflow.html#editing] lists the following limitations:

*  Existing workflow steps cannot be deleted.
* Associated status for each existing step cannot be edited.
* Step IDs for existing steps cannot be changed.

There is a fourth limitation. If the step has not outgoing transitions, you cannot add one transition in the draft. The step window shows the following message:

{noformat}
The step ... has no outgoing transitions in the Active workflow, so you cannot add any outgoing transitions in the Draft workflow.
{noformat}
This limitation should be documented
fields.summary: Edit active workflow undocumented limitation

fields.description:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13/servers/tomcat55.html

The only clue is this:
{quote}
Notice the lack of minEvictableIdleTimeMillis and timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis  parameters - those should only be used with hsql. If using a different database than hsql, remember to update the field-type-name (see above) and copy the JDBC driver jar to common/lib/ (see the database configuration guide).
{quote}

This is very easy to miss. 

Luckily under troubleshooting, we get this:
bq. If using an external database, did you copy the JDBC driver jar to common/lib/ (step 5)?

Indeed, even after reading the troubleshooting note, I still had to search hard to find where it was.
fields.summary: I think it we should make it more clear that the user needs to include JDBC drivers in the WAR install docs "Installing JIRA on Tomcat 5.5".

fields.description:
The following error message often appears in my atlassian-jira.log :

2009-01-13 14:13:24,925 http-8080-2 ERROR [bc.issue.search.AbstractIssuePickerSearchProvider] Error while executing search request
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: fieldName must not be null
(see the full stack trace in the attachment)

The error message comes from Lucene : http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/lucene/java/trunk/contrib/analyzers/src/java/org/apache/lucene/analysis/fr/FrenchAnalyzer.java?view=markup
A similar bug as been reported for Confluence : CONF-12711
Something similar has been reported in another application : http://www.nabble.com/lucene-FrenchAnalyser-bad-implementation-td15561023s13679.html
and their workaround was to delete the line throwing the exception : the "fieldName" variable is not used, and there's nothing similar in other languages.

I suppose the bug is in Lucene, but I'm not sure.
fields.summary: A message "java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: fieldName must not be null" appears in the log when indexing language is French

fields.description:
Hi,

In jira there is a concept of "active project" and there is some features associated with the active project :

- when user click on "create new issue", the active project is selected
- the quick search accept to search an issue number without the project key in the active project

etc....

However there is no indication about the active project in the UI. It could be interessting to have the list of projects in a drowpdown list on top of the UI with the active project selected (and eventually to let user change the active project with this list).
fields.summary: Emphasize active project name

fields.description:
If you add the Time Tracking field to any of the workflow screens, you are able to enter a empty value for the remaining estimate.  When you set the remaining estimate via the Log Work screen, it disallows an empty value. 

Steps to reproduce: 

# Enable Time Tracking
# Add Time Tracking field to Workflow Screen / Resolve issue screen
# Create an issue and set the estimated time
# log work on the issue
# Perform a workflow transition on that issue that will show a screen with the time tracking field, leave remaining estimate empty
# JIRA will accept the input and perform the transition, remaining estimate will show as "Not Specified". 

JIRA should actually reject the empty remaining estimate as per the Log Work screen. 

The workaround is to not add the time tracking fields to screens and use the Log Work feature instead.
fields.summary: When Time Tracking field is displayed on screens, you can enter empty value for Remaining Estimate

fields.description:
We are working on a potential workflow as part of our Jira evaluation.    We have an "investigation" to "accept" transition and at that point (and really, any point throughout the workflow), we would only allow the logged in user to assign the issue to themselves or another member of a group that user belongs to.  The only exception to this would be that the user can change the component (which can change the assignee to someone outside user's group) and set the issue back to an "open" state.

As I understand it, the default behavior of Jira is to allow the logged in user to assign the issue to anyone who is in the developer role for a project. That is not restrictive enough for us.

The reason we need this is to prevent a user from "accepting" an issue and assigning it to a user outside their group, which would then mean the new assignee would be getting this issue in the "accepted" state instead of the "investigation" state.

How would I go about doing this?
fields.summary: We would like to allow users to only assign issues to themselves or a member of any group the logged in user belongs to.

fields.description:
#1 We use greenhopper in a setup where we divide the work is usally divided between two teams. Using filtering, there may be other components touched by the other team at a subtask. Then the developer as well as marking the subtask components, need today to update the parent component. 

#2 I organise my tasks and subtask into sprints (Scrum) releases. Task to be delivered I organise in a release, but only the parent task, since those are the one understandable to business. Sub-tasks are for the developer, to divided the work. But since I use the components list in a release to see which component need to be deployed in the release, I need to make sure manually that all parent task contain all subtasks components. 

As far as I see it, a parent component is always the accumulate of sub tasks component. However, the parent components are helpfull to give a default component list to the sub task.

What are your thoughts?
fields.summary: Option to let sub tasks components be accumulated into parents components list

fields.description:
If you have a cascading select custom field defined which has the same 1st level (parent) items but different values 2nd level items for each different project context then it is not appear it is possible to query across projects for these first level items.

Setup:
Add a Cascading Select custom field
Define 3 contexts (2 for projects, one default)
Define all contexts with the same first level items, but different 2nd level item
Create some issues for each of the two projects.

Now try to filter on the first level of the cascading select.

Expected result: Issues from all projects with that particular value should be found
Result: No issues were returned by the filter.

Suggestion: Update the filter to allow searching for text rather than customfield value ID (which are different per context for cascading select's) OR allow some way for the ID's to be the same if the text is the same.
fields.summary: Cascading select with similar contexts are not queryable across projects

fields.description:
Currently and deviations from the default bugzilla installation require modification of source code to provide the mappings for status / fields etc. We should provide a GUI for defining the mappings in a similar way that the CSV importer does. This will improve the process as the bugzilla importer is often a source of trouble and its difficult to support because of the requirement to hack source code. 

Similarly this would be the same for other issue tracker imports
fields.summary: Provide user interface for bugzilla importer mappings

I didn't test this thoroughly so let me know if it doesn't replicate on your side. I also did some funny things with the renderers before this bug occurred.

fields.description:
It is possible to [configure Lucene with System properties|http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-636].  Unfortunately if this is used, it will affect all instances of Lucene running on that JVM (or system).

[Compass|] takes advantage of this in its configuration.  When a Compass webapp is deployed in the same webapp server, it will make it so JIAR can not index.

This is a Compass/Lucene issue, not an issue within JIRA.
fields.summary: JIRA incompatible with Compass 1.x (fixed in 2.x) based apps running in the same JVM

fields.description:
After upgrading from 3.10 to 3.13 *a huge jump I know,
I can no longer share filters with every group, only groups I am a member of. 


as an administrator I expect to be able to do this.  I see this as a regression in the product
As an administrator I also expect to be able to take over filters from users and delete them when necessary.

Please do something to allow administrators more permissions and not take away rights.


--To workaround this I am going to have either
1. Add a new user to each group who is just used for creating filters 
The problem with this is that I project manage many dev groups and do not want to maintain numerous users and logins for my one jira system.
2. Add myself to every group
The problem with this is that the tech leads will see my assigned issues in their team counts which is not correct
fields.summary: jira administrator cannot share filters with all groups

fields.description: I edit a parent task and change the component.  The subtask component is not changed.
fields.summary: Changing a Parent Task's Component Does Not Change the Component of the Subtask

fields.description:
Hi, 

We like to modify the time tracking system to be at a higher level, with just a rough "started" and "stopped" work toggle:

How hard would it be to add a button that someone could toggle when they started working on a bug and agan when they stop working on a bug? The system could then automatically calculate how much calendar time the developer says went into the bug before the developer marks the bug 'implemented'. For extra credit, the accrued calendar time should be added to if the bug is reopened after going to 'verify' rather than being reset each time the bug is marked 'implemented'. 

The ratio of estimated work days to calendar work days is 'velocity', and provides a basis for estimating at any given point in time how many more calendar days will be required to complete the remaining estimated work.
fields.summary: Modify time tracking to have a simplified start/stop

fields.description:
An error in the "assigned to me" portlet causes a stacktrace to be shown in that portlet.
This should be a simple error message, with details in the log for the following reasons:
* The stacktrace makes the problem even worse for the user.
* Showing implementation details to normal users is considered a security risk.
fields.summary: Stack traces should not be shown in Dasboard portlets

fields.description:
[Surviving Connection Closures|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Surviving+Connection+Closures] includes using {{autoReconnect=true}} in the connection URL.
This is not recommended to be used, we should just use the {{validationQuery}} (which is already included).

The sample URL should look like:
{noformat}
<Resource name="jdbc/JiraDS" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
    driverClassName="com.mysql.jdbc.Driver"
    url="jdbc:mysql://localhost/jiradb?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF8"
    username="jirauser"
    password="jirapassword"
    maxActive="20"
    validationQuery="select 1" />
{noformat}

Note that I changed the order of properties and added some indenting. This is not necessary, but I think it aids readability.
fields.summary: The "Surviving Connection Closures" page on Confluence still includes autoReconnect=true in the example MySQL configuration

fields.description:
JIRA Support Request feature could be improved to be of more immediate use for support and internal systems. 

For more information on the issues with this feature and proposed solution see the [INSTDATA|http://labs.atlassian.com/wiki/display/INSTDATA/Home] project.

For this iteration I would like to ask only for two simple improvements:
# add a unique header parameter to the existing message that we could use to uniquely identify these requests in the support mailbox. E.g. X-JIRA-Support-Request-Version=1.0 or something along those lines.
# attach the collected properties to the message in a machine readable form. I.e. properties.store() should even do at this stage. Attaching the properties to the message will avoid them getting mingled with security and copyright warnings, personal signatures and wrapping etc.
fields.summary: Support Request feature improvement
